title: Ticket #4203: Home directory disappearance crashes schedd
description:
User serves some home directories off of NFS. When it was down, the schedd crashed in a loop. 

01/30/14 16:02:54 warning: setting UserUid to [NUMBER A], was [NUMBER B] previously
01/30/14 16:02:54 Error: chdir(/home/[PATH]) failed: No such file or directory
01/30/14 16:02:54 Open of ./[FILENAME].dag.lib.out failed, errno 13
01/30/14 16:02:54 Open of ./[FILENAME].dag.lib.err failed, errno 13
01/30/14 16:02:54 warning: setting UserUid to [NUMBER C], was [NUMBER A] previously
(Original log in the support ticket)
remarks:
2014-Mar-03 11:49:02 by pfc:
Just to clarify, we're assuming that nothing can be done for jobs owned by (or referencing) an unavailable NFS server. But we have ~7 fileservers now, and may add more soon, and as the number of fileservers increases, the schedd is becoming increasingly fragile to an outage of any of them.

We'd like the schedd not to crash, and other jobs which are independent of that server not to be affected.
